00020 #include <rdkcore/logging/logging.h>
00021 #define LOGGING_MODULE "Repository"
00022 
00023 #include "repository.h"
00024 
00025 namespace RDK2 { namespace RepositoryNS {
00026 
00027 // FIXME the only module that uses this is remotepropertymanager
00028 bool Repository::queuePush(CUrl url, RDK2::Object* object) throw (NoSuchProperty, InvalidOperation)
00029 {
00030     Property* p = getProperty(url);
00031     bool res = false;
00032     p->lock(HERE);
00033     try {
00034         if (p->getObjectClassName() == "") p->setObjectClassName(QUEUE_CLASSNAME);  // XXX are we sure?
00035         if (!p->isQueue()) throw InvalidOperation("Property '" + url + "' is not a queue");
00036         RObjectPipeQueue* queue = dynamic_cast<RObjectPipeQueue*>(getProperty(url)->object);
00037         //RDK_ERROR_PRINTF("Pushing something in '%s' (%p)", url.c_str(), queue);
00038         if (p->url.isComplete() && p->url.getHost() != getRepositoryName()) {
00039             RDK_DEBUG_PRINTF("Sending object to a queue in repository '%s'",
00040                 p->url./*getHost().*/c_str());
00041             sendObjectsToRemoteQueueSubscribers(p->url, object);
00042         }
00043         if (queue) {
00044             res = queue->push(object, HERE);
00045             queue->gc(HERE);
00046         }
00047         // NOTE: sessions listening (which have subscribed this queue) are awaken by the queue itself
00048     }
00049     catch (...) { } // FIXME
00050     p->unlock();
00051     return res;
00052 }
